com.scriptbasic.factories

Class BasicFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.scriptbasic.factories.AbstractFactory
      • com.scriptbasic.factories.GenericFactory
        • com.scriptbasic.factories.BasicFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Factory

    public class BasicFactory
extends GenericFactory
    This extension of the concrete class GenericFactory does return an object instance even if there was no call to AbstractFactory.create(Class, Class) previously.

    To do that the class contains a list of classes for the interfaces that are used by the BASIC interpreter and this way it knows which class (implementing the interface by the way) should be instantiated by the Factory when get(Class) is called.

    Author:
    Peter Verhas

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public <T extends FactoryManaged> T get(java.lang.Class<T> interfac)
        Get an instance of the interface. Some of the implementation define the class that implements the interface and if there was no preceding call to Factory.create(Class, Class) then instantiate the class. This version of the method creates a new instance if there is no object in the factory associated with the interface passed as argument.
        Specified by:
        get in interface Factory
        Overrides:
        get in class GenericFactory
        Parameters:
        interfac - the interface. It is an error to pass a class that is not an interface. In that case the implementation may throw BasicInterpreterInternalError.
        Returns:
        the instance implementing the interface.
